examples.text: Household incomes go up
Families earn more money
People’s salaries increase
Workers get higher pay at their jobs
A family has extra money to buy a new TV
Commodities sell well even if they are expensive
People keep buying things even when prices are high
Expensive products still sell a lot
Household incomes go down
Families earn less money
People’s salaries get smaller
A worker’s pay is cut by the company
A family has less money to buy clothes
Commodities don’t sell well even if they are cheap
People don’t buy much even when things are cheap
Low prices still don’t bring many sales
Household incomes go down
Families earn less money
People’s salaries get smaller
A worker’s pay is cut by the company
A family has less money to buy clothes
Commodities don’t sell well even if they are cheap
People don’t buy much even when things are cheap
Low prices still don’t bring many sales
A shop sells clothes at discount but no one buys
A car company lowers prices but customers don’t come
Demand is lower than supply
There are too many goods but not enough buyers
Companies make more than people want to buy
A factory produces 1000 shoes but only 300 are sold
Farmers have extra vegetables that no one buys
